case_vignette: A 38-year-old homeless man presents to the emergency department for a rash. He states he has noticed the rash for the past several weeks and that it has not been improving. The patient has no history of medical care and no previous diagnoses. Review of systems is positive for a persistent dry cough and recent weight loss. His temperature is 100°F (37.8°C), blood pressure is 107/68 mmHg, pulse is 110/min, respirations are 16/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got a rash for several weeks now that's not getting better, a constant dry cough, and I've recently lost some weight.
Have you had any fever or chills?
Yes, I've had a fever.
Have you had any contact with someone who has recently traveled to a tropical region or has a history of tuberculosis?
I don't know, I haven't kept track of that.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or eating habits?
Yes, I've recently lost some weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or sleep quality?
That's not something I've noticed or focused on.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels or work schedule?
I don't have any work, and I'm homeless, so my stress is pretty constant.
Have you had any recent changes in your living conditions or environment?
My living conditions haven't changed; I'm still homeless.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
I haven't mentioned any specific changes in my diet or eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
I've had no history of medical care and no previous diagnoses, so no medications.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or genetic background?
No, that's not something that can change.
Final Diagnosis: Tuberculosis.
